result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane T. Lancour

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Shane T. Lancour
Current: 1803 Onalaska Avenue, La Crosse, WI 54603 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2022)
Prior: 517 Court St, Rm 308, c/o Clark County Jail, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States

2:11 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shane T. Lancour not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Shane T. Lancour.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on defendants non appearance. State recommends a warrant.  
Court orders a bench warrant.

2:46 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shane T. Lancour appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Shane T. Lancour.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Steiner is heard. 

1W - Deputy Berg, sworn
Exam by Atty Steiner 
Cross by Atty Erickson 

Atty Steiner is heard. State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Erickson objects to bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Erickson is heard on bond. 
Court is heard, no bond modification. The $500.00 cash bond will remain the same.
Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

4:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shane T. Lancour appeared by video, in custody at the Clark County Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Shane T. Lancour.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Defendants is heard. Defendant is at the Clark county jail. Defendant is heard on warrant and requests a signature bond.
Court will cancel the warrant. Court will not reduce or modify the bond. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel -  Atty Jeffrey Warren Erickson

9:39 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shane T. Lancour not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
     Def. failed to appear for initial appearance.  D.A. requests warrant and he be held for hearing.
     Court authorizes warrant.
     Court concludes at 9:40 a.m.
The Hearing for 3/21/22 at 2:00 PM is moved to 3/24/22 at 9:30 AM as the District Attorney will be with another judge on 3/21/22.

2:57 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shane Tyler Lancour appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court finds probable cause. 

DA is heard on bond. Requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. Requests a signature bond. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
